meanings.sent1: The hyphal structure of the fungus helped it absorb nutrients efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the hyphal characteristics of the mold under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The hyphal growth on the bread looked like tiny threads holding it together.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity spread through the classroom like hyphal connections, linking ideas together.
meanings.sent5: The hyphal nature of the roots allowed the plant to spread and thrive in the soil.

meanings.sent1: The hyphal network of the mushroom formed a complex underground system.
meanings.sent2: The hyphal structure of the mold made it easy to spread and colonize new surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The hyphal pattern on the fabric looked like a maze of interconnected lines.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts grew and intertwined like a hyphal web, connecting various concepts in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The hyphal appearance of the clouds in the sky created a mesmerizing and intricate display.
